body.p: Compact bones contain structures that are oriented .

response.feedback: Correct. Compact bone contains organized tubular osteons, which contain blood vessels for material transport.
Incorrect. Compact bone contains organized tubular osteons, which contain blood vessels for material transport.

part.hint: The long bones contain compact bone along their diaphysis (shaft). Consider the type of stresses on these long bones and how their structure might benefit this.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Osteons are organized in the direction of force so that they can resist tension and compression in the direction of force. For example, standing puts compressive forces on the long bones of the legs.

Correct. Osteons are organized in the direction of force so that they can resist tension and compression in the direction of force. For example, standing puts compressive forces on the long bones of the legs.

part.hint: Compact bone often supports weight or is involved in lifting of objects. The weight is generally along the long-axis of the bone.

body.p: Spongy bone contains structures that are oriented .

response.feedback: Correct. Spongy bone contains a mesh-like structure of trabeculae plates. The random orientation helps distribute forces in many directions and acts as a shock absorber.. It is not completely random as greater trabecular density generally occurs in the directions experiencing the most force.
Incorrect. Spongy bone contains a mesh-like structure of trabeculae.

part.hint: Osteons are tubular structures that are tightly packed together. Trabeculae occur as individual supporting “struts” separated from each other.
